One table is a mass of p The other is covered with tanks of spiders, snakes and scorpions.  Tubes run from the lethal beasts into a jar o milky fluid labeled VENOM. More tubes run from the Venom jar into the plants.   One plant twitches as it receives the toxins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can only find the correct dose of Venom, these plants will be able to fight back like animals.   I will have given flora a chance against the thoughtless ravages of man. (OVER) An agonized SCREAM. Terrified, Pam walks towards the source of the WAILS, a gothic prison door to which th tent is affixed.  The portal is marked:  PROJECT GILGAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal note:  my work would proceed faster if Dr. Woodrue weren't always whisking my Venom samples back to his mysterious Gilgamesh Wing.  Why won't he let me into his lab? (OVER)  Another blood-curdling SCREAM.  Pam turns off the recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing in there? 119        Just then the door opens, a startled Pam dropp recorder as lightning flashes and DOCTOR JASON WOODRUE ENTERS.  Einstein's hair.  Manson's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Isley, loveliest flower in our garden.  How fare our little wards? Woodrue moves in, too close, backing Pam against her worktable, his face inches from hers.  He spots the jar o Venom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have here?  A lovely new supply of Venom. (lifts the jar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just take this to my laboratory for further study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly are you working on in there?  What are those screams? A bright flash of lightning.  Woodrue advances on Pam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How I'd love to share my secrets with you.  But I ask you, sweet sapling, can you be trusted?  You refuse my invitations to dine.  You hide your honeyed buds behind these sallow robes. (OVER) More lightning and ever more deafening THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but there's romance in the air tonight.  Perhaps a moonlit stroll in the jungle.  And then, later, in the dark, we can share everything. Woodrue has her up against the wall, his twitching lips only inches from hers.  Pam winces, manages to step away. (OVER) another SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to tell me what you're doing with my Venom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nasty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must show me your secrets, blossom, before I show you mine. 120        Pam watches him leave.  As the door to the Gil swings closed, Pam kicks her fallen recorder, the metal cylinder rolling between door and jamb, keeping the entrance from sealing.

dialogues.text: Pam steals through the crumbling hallway of the abandoned prison following the SCREAMS (OVER) as they grow ever LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks of flashing SuperCrays.  A gurney is surrounded by SPARKING and HUMMING equipment.  Frankestein meets Frankenstien. Woodrue emerges from the shadows, a portable phone in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the un-United Nations. (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our mystery bidder. 123        Pull BACK TO REVEAL A small bridge arcs over the room.  AN AMERICAN GENERAL, A RUSSIAN COMMISSAR, A SHEIK, and A DICTATOR all watch on from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you the future of military conquest. A scrawny PRISONER in a too-large tank suit is dragged into the room by several gun-toting CAPOS and shackled to the gurney.  His bald skull is adorned with three surgically implanted ducts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I present Antonio Diego, serial murderer serving life in prison and sole surviving volunteer. Diego SPITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what a charmer he is. 124        WIDER.  Pam slips in, unseen, hides behind a s circuit boxes, watching on as Woodrue lifts the jar of milky Venom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The super solder serum, code named Venom, patent pending of course. Woodrue pours the venom into a high-tech injector pack strapped to the back of the gurney.  He lifts an open-fro black and white mask attached by snaking tubes to the injector pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Notice the hassle free zipper. He pulls the oversized mask over Diego's head, tubes fitt into the ducts in his skull, zips the fabric closed over face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifts a remote)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to scream. He hits a control stud on the remote.  The injector pack begins PUMPING the milky Venom into Diego's skull.  Diego SCREAMS. 125        Something strange happens to the prisoner.  Hi begins to enlarge.  His neck becomes thick.  his forearms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold, the ideal killing machine.  I call this little number...Bane. Bane of humanity.  Imagine it, your own personal army made up of thousands of these super soldiers.  Bidding begins at a mere 10 million. Woodrue ups the Venom flow.  Impossibly the prisoner grow larger.  Arm and leg shackles SNAP.  Bane lurches for the Venom pump, SMASHING consoles, SPARKING components rainin down around Pam. PAM SCREAMS. As Capos rush to subdue Bane, Woodrue strides to the daze Pam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to my parlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodrue is escorting a nervous Pam back towards her lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Our original sponsor had no stomach for military applications. he cut the funding for our work -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without your research, I could never have come this far.  Join me.  The two of us, entwined, side by side... They have arrived at Pam's workshop.  Woodrue opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join you?  I've spent my life trying to protect plants from extinction and now you corrupt my research into some maniacal scheme for world domination. When I get through you won't be able to get a job teaching high school chemistry, do you hear me, you psycho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can respect your opinion. Woodrue shoves Pam viciously backwards into the inter- connected tables, plants and poisonous beasts raining down on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadly, I'm not good at rejection. Woodrue begins pulling shelves of cages and BUBBLING beakers CRASHING down atop the struggling Pam, burying he and all her specimens entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you'll have to die. 128        WOODRUE - CLOSE.  Smiles as the SOUNDS of Pam' are finally silenced.  He turns, heading back into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud)

dialogues.text: Fellow maniacs, bidding begins!

dialogues.text: Bruce stands with Dick, now wrapped in a blanket, steamin mug in hand, watching the main monitor.

dialogues.text: Gotham University Labs.  Security video.  Two years ago. 130        SCREEN - CLOSE.  The image of a dazzling hi-te oratory.  A beautiful young woman (NORA FRIES) lays on a gurney.  A SCIENTIST works a bank of controls over a SMOKING vat of cryonic solution.  Handsome, the intense gaze of genius, the man Freeze once was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Victor Fries  Two time Olympic Decathelete.  Nobel Prize winner in molecular biology. After his wife contracted a rare disease, McGregor's Syndrome, he hoped to freeze her in cryogenic sleep until he could discover a cure.  Here's where everything goes north. Alarms flash.  A panel EXPLODES. Fries is BLOWN into the vat of cryogenic solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That liquid is fifty below. Fries SCREAMS, engulfed in the mists of the cryonic solution, his skin now frozen, bluish, his hair brittle, all but gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gotta hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow he survived.  But the cryoslution mutated his body. 131        The display shows a turning schematic of Fries

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to his wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Presumed dead.  No one knows. The display now shows a turning Mr. Freeze.  Compartments in both suit sleeves are highlighted, flashing diamond shapes within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs extreme cold to survive. His cryo-suit uses diamond enhanced lasers to keep him at zero degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight. A brilliant citizen, disfigured by a horrible accident, re-emerges as a psychotic super-villain bent on theft, revenge and destruction. You see a pattern here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: <                Maybe it's something in the water. Bruce returns Dick's smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it's ice the iceman wants...Alfred!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred stands near the costumes, clutching a console, a man in intense pain. He lets the wave subside, regains hi composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred emerges as if nothing were wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the Wayne Diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna trap ourselves a snowman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  Just as soon as you take ten hours training in the simulator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, I made a mistake.  I'm sorry. Don't go all protective on me.  It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, you were reckless.  You could have been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.  See.  Me.  here.  Alive. How are we gonna work together if you're never going to trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How, indeed? Bruce stares at the two of them.  He smiles a wry smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did I become the bad guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Alfred travel the winding stair that leads from the Batcave to the top of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's over-eager, impulsive.  I can't trust him not to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the truth is you don't really trust anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you're on his side. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite all your talents, you are still a novice in the ways of family. Dick follows the same ends as you but gets there by his own course.  You must learn to trust him.  For that is the nature of family. They step through a doorway into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you, Alfred. Alfred seems oddly pained by Bruce's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I shan't be here forever. Bruce stares at Alfred a beat.  But Alfred just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Master Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce EXITS his butler's room.  Looks to the end of the hallway. 135B        A YOUNGER BRUCE, no older than ten comes raci the corner, trips, tumbling to the wooden floor.  Another figure steps out behind him.  ALFRED, decades younger, kn by the boy, brushing off his knees, giving the boy comfor

dialogues.speaker: 135C BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: BRUCE - CLOSE.  Blinks away the images from the past, onl fragile ghosts of memory, moves off down the empty hallwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred sit at his computer, activates the screen.  he lifts a CD, slips in into the disk drive, begins to TYPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Override engaged.  Copying protected files. Alfred lifts a micro-recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still unable to reach you.  have vital information you must see... 136        SCREEN - CLOSE.  The files Alfred is copying. design.  Batsuit schematics.  All downloading onto the sm disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon shines over the hidden complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodrue stands at Pam's workstation, TALKING on his portable phone as he rifles through her research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I'm so pleased you won the bidding, Your Supreme Ruthlessness.. (OVER) Bane SCREAMS in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're making the final modifications on Bane right now.  We'll have a thousand super soldiers out to you tomorrow by overnight mail... 139        He hangs up.  HOLD on a patch of ivy in the b. still.  Suddenly the leaves RUSTLE, as if being moved fro beneath. Woodrue turns as a figure BURSTS, fast, from beneath the brush. Magenta hair.  Chlorophyll green eyes.  Ravaged clothes revealing the form and demeanor of a goddess.  The woman who was once Pamela Isley smiles, moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Isley?  Pamela?  You look great. Especially for a dead woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jason.  I think I've had a change of heart. Her lips glisten.  She leans in and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite literally.  I don't think I'm human anymore.  The animal-plant toxins had a rather unique effect on me. They replaced my blood with aloe, my skin with chlorophyll and fill my lips with Venom. Woodrue begins to CHOKE.  He falls, clutching his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Jason?  One other thing. Silly me, I probably should have mentioned this earlier.  I'm poison. (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a jungle in here. 140                Pam spills beakers of chemicals onto t throws a Bunsen burner to the ground, the lab suddenly in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the flames touch the sky. For I am nature's arm, her spirit, her  will.  Hell, I am mother nature. The time has come for plants to take back the world so rightfully ours. Because it's not nice to fool with mother nature. Something catches Pam's eye.  Pam lifts a broken beaker On it, the Wanye Enterprises logo.  (OVER) Bane SCREAMS in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming, Bane darling.  We've got a plane to catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An abandoned ice cream factory built in the shape of a snowman's face, a dripping cone stuck onto the giant snowball head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandoned.  Always freezing.  Ice sculpture everywhere. Freeze walks the bowels of the old factory. ICEMEN in parkas and SNOW BUNNIES eat frozen dinners, GUFFAWING as they watch TV.  The SEXIEST BUNNY sidles up to Freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freezy, I'm feeling...hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find that unlikely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, my hair is brittle, my skin is dry and I don't care.  I'd weather blizzards to have you. You're the most perfect man I've ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be frozen.  To never change.  A life of perpetual ice-olation. There is little perfection in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What say we turn up the heat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're skating on thin ice.  My passion thaws for my bride alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget your frosty femme.  These lips are wet and ready to get frostbite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hop away little bunny.  Before I cool your jets.  Permanently. The Bunny storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder how cold I can get my shower...Frosty! Freeze's faithful aide, FROSTY, appears by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is always having a good time.  Except me.  Try as I might, can find no pleasure.  Perhaps my heart truly has turned to ice. 143        Freeze lifts his gun and FIRES, freezing Frost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was fun.  There's hope for me yet. 143A        Freeze stares at his frozen aide a beat, chan setting on his gun and FIRES, a THAWING BEAM melting Frosty so he stands now, soaked and dripping like a wet c 143B        Freeze turns on his heel.  Frosty follows him mounting files of research.  Scrawled schematics  An icy workshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm mad, Frosty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wringing out his sleeves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really a judgment call, boss. 145        A flashing display on his suit watch reads LOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battling the bat exhausted my power. From a safe, Freeze takes three small diamonds, place them in the suit compartment.  His power levels spike to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was successful nevertheless. 146        Freeze continues to a pedestal atop which sits powered by two giant diamonds.  Slots for two more diamon are empty.  He removes the giant stolen diamond from with his tunic, place the gem in an empty third slot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more giant diamond of this size and my freezing cannon will be complete.  I will hold Gotham ransom. Unless the city bows to my demands, it's winter forever here in goat-town. The city fathers will have no choice but to give me the billions I need to complete my research, to find the cure for... 146        Freeze has come to a frozen wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us.  We need quality time. 148        As Frosty EXITS in the b.g., Freeze enters a w freezer, lifts a frozen dinner box.  A SECRET VAULT opens Freezes steps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within, a computerized glacier-like sarcophagus bears his frozen wife, a snowflake pendant around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches the glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon we will be together once more. Freeze turns towards his research, heading back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing frustrates a man like a  frigid wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin is fighting Mr. Freeze and his cronies.  Robin delivers a fast set of spinning kicks to the Thugs, felling them like toys. 150        A Thug carrying a large diamond breaks free, r Robin leaps for the escaping Thug, putting his back to Freeze. 151        Freeze raises his joined fists high above Robi coming down fast.  Robin is done for. 152        Suddenly Batman swing out of the dark, his boo into Freeze's chest, sending the villain hard to the ground. 153        Batman drops to Freeze's chest, HAMMERS a seri punches into his tunic, rendering him unconscious.  Batma looks up at Robin.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: We'll be starting again now. 155        Just then Freeze's hand shoots up, grabbing Ba throat.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: Pause virtual reality simulation. PUSH IN as Batman reaches towards his cowl.  SCREEN WIPES TO REVEAL... 157        BRUCE WAYNE - CLOSE.  Pulls off a pair of VR g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Dick, also in VR goggles, stand on an empty platform in the back of the Batcave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the diamond.  Quell problemo, Bruce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left your back wide open.  Freeze could have killed you. 158        Dick demonstrates a spinning back kick that wo dropped Freeze in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it covered. (OVER) A doorbell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, in the circus, The Flying Graysons were a team.  We had to trust each other.  We had to count on each person to do his part.  That's what being partners is all about. (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End simulation. 159        Ambient lights come up in the cave.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Sometimes counting on someone else is the only way to win. (OVER) the doorbell RINGS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Al? Dick heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't we just for once pretend that I'm the teacher and you're the student?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Columns of dancing sunlight fill the giant entryway.  Dic goes to the front door as Bruce meets Alfred emerging in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have dozed off.  My sincerest apologies, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No apology necessary.  That's the first time in thirty years. Bruce smiles, but he can't take his eyes off Alfred.  The butler seems pale, older than usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mystery pizza delivery? 163        Dick opens the door.  A young girl stands in t light, beautiful, dressed in prim, schoolgirl clothes, BARBARA WILSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry to trouble you, but- That's when the girl sports Alfred.  The old man's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Alfred? 164        Barbara rushes in, past Dick and Bruce, into t butler's arms.  he holds her close.  Bruce and Dick face each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce, Alfred, Dick, and Barbara tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has it been, Uncle Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years. (to Bruce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara isn't really me niece, sir. She's Joanna Clark's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Alfred still keeps your mother's picture in his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody want to tell us kids in the cheap seats who Joanna Clark is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanna and I were in love in London. But when I realized our age difference was too extreme -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Alfred left for America.  Much to my mother's dismay -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually she married a young physician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al's main squeeze.  Is she here? (off everyone's looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about to scrape the bottom of my shoe off my tongue, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents were killed in an auto accident ten years ago.  Alfred has been supporting me ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secrets are a virtual prerequisite in this house, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on break from-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxbridge Academy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their new computer sciences division.  How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recognized the accent. 167        They have come to the garage.  A motorcycle si front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  It's beautiful. The way the sun catches Barbara, she looks like an angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can say that again. (catching himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a competition racer I've been fixing up.  Maybe one day I'll show you how to ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You certainly will not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, those things frighten me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope you'll stay with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lovely inn just down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this luxury really isn't my style but- (still eyeing the bike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but, sir.  So much goes on-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly, Alfred. After all, she's family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vintage DC-3 steams on the runway.  Pilots descend the gangway. Pamela Isley, dressed as a grieving window, supervises th LUGGAGE HANDLERS' debarkation of a coffin.  An immense coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be gentle.  He's always been touchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, lady. Pam watches the Handlers carry the coffin away.  She turn walks off across the tarmac. 171        FAVOR THE BAGGAGE HANDLERS as they bear the co terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Pam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always been touchy.  Right. 172        A GIANT FIST CRASHES through the splintering l Handlers drop the coffin as a figure emerges. Bane, wearing his full costume, his injector pack strapped to his back. Bane lifts a Handler, begins swinging him like a baseball bat, sending the other Handlers flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIMOUSINE sits at the edge of the runway.  A lone BUSINESSMAN approaches the waiting car.  The DRIVER smile opens the door.  he Businessman climbs in to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam sits sprawled on the back seat, showing no small bit of leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be some mistake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly darling, there's no need to pretend in front of the driver. She grabs his face kisses him passionately.  She lets go, the Businessman slumps to the seat.  Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love hurts.  In my case it kills.

dialogues.speaker: THE REARVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: 176        The limo driver watches on.  Suddenly a hand r SNAPPING his neck, drags out his body.  Bane climbs into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once around the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is ajar.  (OVER) a gentle KNOCK.  Barbara pushes inside, wearing a long terry robe. The room is empty.  She notices a pile of envelopes on th desk. ENVELOPES - CLOSE.  All addressed to Wilfred Pennyworth. Royal Court of Mirajanpore.  All stamped RETURN TO SENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know sneaking around was on the curriculum at Oxbridge. Barbara starts, turns.  Alfred steps from the shadows in his robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Uncle, I came to tuck you in.  And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came to tuck me in.  That's quite a switch. (off the envelopes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am looking for my brother, Wilfred. He is first butler to the Maharajah of Mirajanpore.  But Mirajanpore is a  floating court, it travels across India, so Wilfred can be rather difficult to find. 178        Alfred TAPS his computer keyboard. 179        SCREEN - CLOSE.  Full motion images of a respl court, carried entirely on the back of elephants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess they don't have fax machines on elephants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been trying to reach Wilfred with no success.  As one grows older, one yearns for family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you again, Uncle. I've missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I've missed you. (kissing her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep well, child. Barbara heads out, closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara walks to her room.  She pauses, waiting for the light under Alfred's door to go out.  Then she disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara whips off her robe. Underneath, a tight black leather motorcycle outfit.  She begins pulling on sleek black boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knotted climbing rope tumbles out of one of the windows A figure expertly descends into the courtyard below. Turns, face now visible in the moonlight.  Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids collect Matchbox and Corgi.  Billionaires collect th real thing.  Barbara ENTERS, cloaked in the shadows, move stealthfully past the myriad cards until she comes to the row of motorcycles. She stops at a sleek competition bike, climbs on, pulling racing helmet from her back-pack, expertly kick-starts th ENGINE. 184        Barbara rides out through the open garage into night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze is standing at his computerized work-station, entering data into the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this time, this new formula, will return you to me. Freeze hits a switch.  A beat.  Then an ALERT panel flash simple message:        TEST FAILURE.  Freeze SLAMS the console with his fist. FOLLOW FREEZE as he rises, walks through the open door into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze stares up at his wife in her frozen sarcophagus, fighting back the tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cure tonight, my love.  Forgive me.  But soon, I promise you.  Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.  Bane drives. Ivy sits in the back seat, applyin brown contact lenses, donning a dark wig.  Pamela Isley once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Charlie jingle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of Hip, kind of Wow, Ivy.  Kind of Free, kind of Now, Ivy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stone and copper observatory in the process of being restored, set atop the banks above the Gotham River and the city beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An immense circular hall under construction.  Within, a partially installed telescope.  Bruce stands flanked by his stunningly beautiful date (JULIE MADISON), a SCIENTIS and his ASSOCIATE, all on a podium backed by blueprints, facing the PRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father once told me that to succeed we need only pick our star and follow it.  And so Wayne Enterprises is donating the world's most advanced telescope to Gotham's Observatory Restoration Project. Perhaps this telescope will give future generations a chance to find their own stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brucy, is it true this new telescope can see all around the globe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, if you'll watch the monitors - 189        A MONITOR BANK - CLOSE.  A graphic of the eart Equidistant satellites in geosyncronous orbit are highlighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satellites already in orbit allow us to reflect light around the planet. ON SCREEN - A graphic ray of light is reflected from a satellite over Australia, to a satellite over the U.S., and then beamed to a graphic of the Gotham-based telescop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here we'll be able to see the sky anywhere on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't point it at my bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brucy, you and the exquisite Julie Madison have been going out forever. Are you planning to tie the knot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get married?  me?  No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm.  What I mean is...no plans at the moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...Sooner or later...all relationships evolve and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get some help over here? Julie smiles, turns to the PRESS. the very picture of composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and I are lucky enough to be recklessly in love. And that is most certainly enough for us. (to Bruce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now. FOLKS LAUGH, charmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if you'll all follow me, I'll show you the central control grid... The Scientist and Associate tour Julie and the Press arou the telescope, leaving Bruce to confer with two of his Ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam, hair in a bun, face behind glasses, cloaked in a frumpy suit, is standing behind two door GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have a pass, sir. BRUCE smiles, waves off the guards with a gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're overly protective.  You're Not going to hurt me are you, Ms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Pamela Isley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Doctor?  A research grant?  A hospital wing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I already work for you. Or did.  Your arboreal preservation project in South America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut our support.  A conflict of ideologies.  Dr. Woodrue was a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you knew him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lab was consumed by fire last week.  how did you manage to escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have here a proposal showing how Wayne Enterprises can immediately cease all actions that toxify our environment. Bruce takes the proposal, scans it.  Pam's eyes shine despotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the stars.  Look here, at the Earth, our mother, our womb.  She deserves our loyalty and protection. And yet you spoil her lands, poison her oceans, blacken her skies. You're killing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your intentions are noble, but no diesel fuel for heat.  No coolants to preserve food.  Millions would die of cold and hunger alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acceptable losses in a battle to save the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People come first, Dr. Isley. 191        The tour has returned.  Pam turns to the Press Begins to soapbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mammals.  So smug in your towers of stone and glass.  A day of reckoning is coming.  The same plants and flowers that saw you crawl blind from the primordial soup will reclaim this planet.  Earth will be a garden again.  Somehow, some way, I will bring your man-made civilization to its knees and there will be no one to protect you. Pam's tirade is so extreme, folks around her LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be new in town.  In Gotham City, Batman and Robin protect us. Even from plants and flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd like to meet them. Bruce nods and an Aide hands Pam an invitation. 192        INVIATION - CLOSE.  Batman and Robin to appear Flower Ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caped crusaders are helping us auction off a prized diamond to raise money for the Gotham Botanical Gardens.  Just a few mammals doing what we can for our world's plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Brucy, will the delicious Ms. Madison be your date for the flower ball tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, billionaire, would you warm faster to my pleas if I looked more like Ms. January here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although the Wayne Foundation is hosting the event, sadly I will be unable to attend.  Thank you all. (to Pam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day, Doctor. Pam watches him go, trailed by press.  Peers at her invit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman and Robin.  Militant arm of the warm-blooded oppressors.  Animal protectors of the status quo.  First I'll rid myself of the fur and feathered pests.  And then Gotham will be mine for the greening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 194        Nora and Victor Fries kiss at their wedding al 195        video images change to show the couple playing 196        puppy.  Nora LAUGHS as her husband crowds besi EXITS frame, hands her something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Victor, it's beautiful. Nora holds her snow-flake necklace up for the camera. Places it around her neck, smiling up tot he warm summer sun.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Freeze sits watching the images on his screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me, chief.  I got something her you might want to see. 198        Frosty stands in the door, newspaper in hand. shifting his gaze, Freeze lifts his freezing gun, FIRES. Frosty Freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it when people talk during the movie. 199        Freeze continues staring at the screen.  Final images are just too much for him.  He FIRES his gun at th screen, the picture EXPLODING into flying shards of light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more diamond, my love.  One more. 200        Freeze rises.  he breaks off the cover of the 201        in Frosty's hand.  PAPER-CLOSE.  Wayne Donates Flower Ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
