Barbara can't see his face, but it's Dick. 308        The finish line is coming up fast.  Instead of both GUN their ENGINES. 309        THE FINISH LINE - CLOSE.  Barbara flies over t Dick a hair behind her, and then both shoot over the edge of the unfinished bridge, into the air, soaring high abov the abyss. 310        Dick's front wheel hits the metal roadway on t side of the gap, spinning rubber catching steel. 311        Barbara's front wheel hits the edge badly, rol backward. 312        Dick spins over his shoulder, sees what's happ Barbara's bike is losing purchase, slipping backwards over the edge. 313        Dick ditches his still moving bike and helmet, off on tucked shoulder, leaping towards the edge as Barbaraâ€™s bike finally slips, she and her hog tumbling downwards into the abyss. 314        Dick's jump sends him over the edge, hands ext catching the lip of the bridge, hand grabbing Barbara's ankle, her bike plummeting beneath her as her helmet fall into the water below. 315        Dick hangs by one foot, holding a dangling Bar ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is where you hang out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara stands in the b.g. receiving her winnings from Banker and Spike.  Dick rights his bike as she approaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have made it, you know.  I didn't need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, lady.  It's all in a day's work for me. Barbara tries to hand Dick her winnings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is to replace the bike I lost. I'll get you the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Dick Grayson, ward of the fabulously wealthy Bruce Wayne. Why would you need a few hundred dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess, the truth is I'm just not comfortable with the idle rich.  Even when they try to act like heroes. Dick pats the back of his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you better get comfortable real fast, sister.  Cause we've only got one bike and it's a long walk home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick and Barbara dismout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started racing after my parents died.  There was something about the speed, the danger, that took me out of myself, that made the hurt go away.  You wouldn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Street racing isn't exactly an acceptable major at Oxbridge.  They kicked me out.  it doesn't matter. I've won enough money to do what I've always dreamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't tell me you're hoping to run away and join the circus. They head towards the entrance tot he house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred has supported me my whole life.  Now I'm going to pay him back. I'm going to liberate him from his dismal life of servitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Servants, Masters, it's  ridiculous. Alfred is the sweetest, most noble man alive and he's subjugated all his life and dreams to someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred and Bruce are like family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paying someone to prepare your meals and do your laundry and clean your dishes, you call that family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred's happy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You honestly don't know, do you? You can't even see what's in front of your own eyes. They've reached the main stair.  Dick stares at her puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at his skin. At how he's hiding the pain all the time.  Can't you see it?  Alfred's sick. And with that, Barbara disappears upstairs.  Dick stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfredâ€™s not sick. Bruce steps from the shadows.  Sits now at the foot of th steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dying.  And I can't deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's never said a word-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Alfred.  He'd never say Anything.  But I can tell.  Until you came along, Alfred was the only family I ever had.  Without him, I don't know how I would have survived.  He saved my life, Dick.  And I've never told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to him, Bruce.  There's nothing worse than losing someone without telling them how you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared, Dick.  Maybe for the first time in my life.  I'm really scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze stands within the anti-thermic field, crafting a tiny ice sculpture of his wife.  He lifts the miniature gearworks from an alarm clock, places the ice sculpture atop of it, the statuette beginning to turn.  He covers t figure with a drinking glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Icehead, you got a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD stands by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sister's here to see you. 323        FREEZE - CLOSE.  Puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister? The Second Guard ENTERS, followed by a woman in a cloak. None other than Poison ivy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny basement room with a single barred window where prisoner's effects are kept.  Mannequins display familiar costumes, Joker's, Riddler's, Freeze's. 325        A GUARD sits against the wall, watching TV.  S fists SMASH through the cement wall and grab the chair, wrenching the seated Guard through the wall in a storm of dust. Bane ENTERS, walks to Freeze's suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Guards stand by the console as the door seals behind Pam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind us, ma'am.  You can converse freely. But Pam isn't interested in Freeze, instead walks to the Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't mind you at all. Pam begins a saunter around the room, shedding her cloak to reveal her skintight Ivy costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not that attractive.  Pretty average I'd say.  But your fantasies aren't average, are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) ALARMS.  Bane, rolling Freeze's suit in a shopping cart, barrels down the hallway, KNOCKING Guards and Doctors into walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam's saunter has brought her back to the two mesmerized Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men.  The most absurd of all Godâ€™s creatures.  We give you life and we can take it back just as easily. She holds one Guard's chin in each hand.  Leans in to kis them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I told you one kiss from me would kill you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really am to die for. She kisses first one, then the other.  They CHOKE, fall. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impressive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I, my most unabominable snowman, have been impressed by you. In fact I propose a pairing.  So I'm here to set you free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enticing offer.  But what does the lady want in return?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's cool it for now.  There's someone I want you to meet. 330        Ivy presses a button and the door slides open. runs in, wheeling Freeze's suit.  Ivy seals the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, a laundry service that delivers. Bane rolls the cart across the cryonic field.  Freeze begins to dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that belt.  What are you, about a fifty Big and Tall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always go a size smaller.  Makes me look slimmer. 331        FREEZE - POV.  His watch like status display s power supply.  Dangerously low.  Auxiliary Power Only. Freeze opens his sleeve compartments.  Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've confiscated my generator diamonds.  I'm running on empty. 332        (OVER) the SHOUTS of approaching Guards.  The laser torch begins to cut around the side of the front door. 333/        IVY hits the Venom pump.  Bane lifts his fist 334        to SHASH the far wall.  It doesn't break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good. 335        (OVER) the SHOUTS of more Guards coming down t Freeze reaches for his holster.  Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gun.  How disarming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if I can get a cell with a view of the gardens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear daisy, don't despair. 336        Freeze walks to a sink set into the cell wall. on the water.  Freeze cracks his gauntlet seal, cryo-gas HISSING out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always winterize your pipes. 337        Freeze aims the gas jet at the spigot.  PIPES room begin to freeze, bulging with the cold, frozen water within them splitting metal, rushing towards, CRACKING, the stone wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall of Freeze's turreted isolation tower begins to CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall has split apart, revealing the night beyond. Bane, Ivy, and Freeze look down at the rushing river far below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate heights. 340        The cell door flies off its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll hate prison more. The three villains jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three tiny figures plummet towards the fast rushing water below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce walks with Alfred through the old house, shutting o lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you well, old friend? Alfred stops, stares into his charge's eyes, then turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am as well as can be expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred, I know you're sick -- I can get you the best doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen the best doctors--! A gentleman does not discuss his health.  It's not civilized.  I hope I've taught you at least that much, young man. Bruce bites back a bitter smile.  He knows better than to push him when he's like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever regretted your life working here, Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attending to heroes?  No sir.  My Only regret is that I was never able to be out there with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all heroes wear masks. Alfred smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred, if I've never told you...I just want to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? Bruce looks away, fighting tears, unable to say the words 342A        BRUCE - POV.  Out the window, a young Bruce p and seek with Alfred, the old Butler gone behind a hedge, then back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze has escaped. OUT THE WINDOW.  The Batsignal shines in the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with flowers.  Bane sits at the wheel, Ivy and Fre in back, watching the Snowy Cones Ice Cream Factory, surrounded now by a police perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My reserves are exhausted.  I must have the gems that power my suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are looking unseasonably hot. Let's go inside and grab your rocks. The Batmobile SCREECHES up.  Batman and Robin race inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my weakened state I am no match for the bat and the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave Batman and Robin to me. Freeze looks skeptical.  Ivy smiles seductively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.  Vegetable magnetism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  While I retrieve my diamonds, you and meatloaf will bring my wife to your lair.  She's frozen in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it.  You never said anything about a wife, frozen or otherwise- Freeze moves fast, grabbing her neck, SMASHING her agains the seat back.  Bane moves in but Ivy SHOOS him off with gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will rescue my wife

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, OK.  Ms. Ivy to the rescue.  Now where do I find your brittle bride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police tagged and tapped.  Batman and Robin examine Freezeâ€™s lab.  Commissioner Gordon ENTERS, drops a video disk in a console player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no sign he came back here after the escape.  We pulled this off the surveillance cameras at Arkham. 346A        MONITOR - CLOSE.  The three villains daring a Batman hits a switch.  The image of Ivy fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's definitely part of this.  It's weird, for a while Ivy was all I could think about.  But then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  The feeling just vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we were fighting over a  bad guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad, yes.  Guy, no.  This is one majorly beautiful evil person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm totally over her.  Positively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.  Great stems, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm-hmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely. Batman has gone to the walk-in freezer.  Examines a wall food.  He lifts a frozen oriental dinner.  The secret vau swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open Sesame...Chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman and Robin ENTER, examine Nora Fries in her sarcophagus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still alive.  He's adapted his freezing technology to reverse McGregor's Syndrome. (off a scrolling monitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's even found a cure for the early stages of the disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he save her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Her case is too advanced.  But maybe, someday, with more research- 346B        FAIRY-LIKE SPIRALS begin winding through the Batman and Robin, both dazed, follow the dust through a snaking passage, wrench open two service doors TO REVEAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bane stands atop a staircase overlooking an industrial basement crisscrossed by catwalks above giant mixing vats and conveyer belts.  He hits a switch, the machinery WHIR to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No beauty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the beast. BATMAN rushes the monster.  Bane SIDESWIPES him, sending flying off the stairs towards the basement below. Robin uses Batman's distraction to SMASH into Bane's ches Robin bounces off, landing hard atop the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch. (standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anymore at home like you? The two begin to fight atop the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front doors BLOW open.  Gordon and the Cops stare up to face Mr. Freeze, standing atop the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate uninvited guests. The Cops race up the stairs towards Freeze.  He pulls a l marked COOLANT GAS.  VENTS around the room begin to HISS freezing gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman has landed in a giant ice cream mixer.  He rolls c of the giant stirring arm, flipping out of the vat to fac Poison Ivy.  She smiles, blows a handful of dust into his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must confess, the combination of heroic daring-do and an anatomically correct rubber suit puts fire in a  girl's...lips. She leans in to kiss him.  Batman stares a beat, shakes i off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do all the gorgeous ones have to be homicidal maniacs?  Is it me? 346F        BATMAN - POV.  Bane is spinning Robin over hi Batman races up the steps towards his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops are fighting through the HISSING coolant gas towards Freeze at the top of the stairs.  Freeze reaches for another lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you boys slip into something more comfortable? 346H        THE ICY STPES - CLOSE.  SNAP into a steep, cu Freeze PUNCHES the lead Cop backwards into his shivering cohorts, the police tumbling in a slipping pile down to the floor below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bane hurls Robin down the steps.  Batman SMASHES into Ban both falling off the platform, taking their fight to a ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin stands, behind him a giant miller's wheel carries planks of wood through a chopper and back up as pallets of popsicle sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her pretty birdie. Robin spins to face Ivy.  She blows a pile of dust into h face.  She begins advancing, backing him towards the chop blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up.  If you threw yourself-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At you?  Polly want a kiss? She leans in, lips pursed. 346K        ON THE CATWALK OVERHEAD Bane's mighty BLOWS b towards the edge of the catwalk. Robin looks from Ivy to Batman, grabs a strut on the mill wheel, the giant cog lifting him up towards the catwalk a his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be losing my touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze is striding through the mists towards his diamond vault.  More Cops rush him from the HISSING gas. FREEZE moves like lightning, WHIPPING billy clubs from th holsters of two police, using them like disconnected nunc KNOCKING the cops unconscious in a flurry of SLAMS and JA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick around. A COP hits the wall.  Beside him a button reads;  EMERGEN HEAT.  He SLAMS the stud, filaments coming to life, the r glowing red. Freeze's watch begins to flash.  No power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bane kicks Batman off the end of the catwalk as Robin lea onto the villain.  Robin and Bane begin fighting again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman lands on his back on a moving belt that is feeding ancient tubs of ice cream into a clown shaped flash freez Ivy jumps atop the caped crusader, their faces close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring out the animal in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have brought my leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough sweet talk. With that Ivy blows another handful of dust into Batman's face.  Ivy licks her lips.  Leans in for a kiss. At the last second, Batman averts his face, wrenching Ivy to the floor just ahead of the clown's freezing maw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mustering all his will)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a lover not a fighter.  That's why every Poison Ivy action figure comes complete with...him. BANE stands atop a giant storage vat, a dazed Robin hangi in his hand.  Bane tosses the boy aside, slide, feet firs down a conveyer belt and double fists Batman, CRASHING, into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm off to find Bachelor Number Two. Try not to make a mess when you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is growing even hotter.  Freeze stagger towards his diamond vault, his flesh turning ray. With his last strength, Freeze wrenches open his safe, filling his sleeve power compartments with diamonds, his color returning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh.  Chilled to perfection. Freeze hits his watch, the villain now suddenly encased in ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops are warming back into action, draw guns, FIRE, bullets bouncing off Freeze's armor of ice, ricocheting into the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman, eat your heart out. Freeze starts towards his weapons locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bane SMASHES Batman into the wall.  Advances.  At the las second, Batman FIRES a Batclub, HITTING Bane in the head stunning him. 346R        BATMAN - POV.  Ivy is closing in on Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops rush Freeze.  The villain whips a small icing je from his weapons locker, the floor GLOWS, suddenly covere with ice. The Cops begin slipping on the glassy floor in classic Keystone style, ending up sprawled on their backs. Freeze stands, pulsing with power, this icing cannon now under one arm.  He lifts his pistol in his free hand.  Po at the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right coppers, Freeze. He FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivy has Robin up against a giant vat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop living in the shadow of the big bad bat.  You don't need him. (blows more dust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You deserve your own legend.  Your own bright shining signal in the sky.  Let me guide you.  Let me... (touches his face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Touch you.  Kiss you. He can't resist, about to kiss her.  A tiny batarang hits his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the victim at the airport. Toxins introduced through the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is she so desperate to kiss us? I'm betting her lips are poison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A poison kiss?  You have some real issues with women, you know that? (advancing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just couldn't stand that she was about to kiss me. (shoves him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't stand that something might be mine and not yours.  Could you?! Robin shoves him harder still.  In frustration, Batman delivers a fantastic roundhouse, sending Robin SMASHING into a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Batman tries to help Robin up.  Robin shrugs him off, sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivy's right.  I don't need you.  I'm going solo.  I want my own signal in the sky. Batman looks around.  Ivy and Bane are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arriving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  How'd they get away? But the caped crusader doesn't have an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivy enters through the snaking passage.  She turns to fac Freeze's wife, still in her frozen sarcophagus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sorry, Ms. Fridigaire.  I'm just not good with competition. Ivy pulls the main power switch.  Status lights flash red

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transformed.  Sunlight streams in through the broken ceiling.  The ground thrives, now a rich garden. 351        IVY ENTERS, strolls through the gardens into a 352        ante-room where Freeze sits over his freezing having ZAPPED the walls with his pistol, the room now a world of ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself right at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was nothing I could do.  Batman deactivated her.  She's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie! 353        Freeze lunges for Ivy.  Bane steps between the Freeze hurls him across the room.  Ivy stills Bane with a gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Ivy reaches up, holding the snowflake necklace between he and the looming Freeze.  Freeze stops, takes the chain in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their bones will turn to ice.  Their blood will freeze in my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them.  Of course.  But why stop there?  Why should only Batman and Robin die while the society that created them goes unpunished? Ivy lifts the frozen Gotham bauble off the iced table. Turns it over in her hand absentmindedly.  Freeze stares her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I shall replay the world for sentencing me to a life without the warmth of human comfort.  I will blanket the city in endless winter. First Gotham and then the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I had in mind.  Everything dead on Earth except us.  A chance for mother nature to start again. (she lifts a flower)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plants and flowers are the oldest species on the planet yet they are defenseless against man.  Sorry hon, this is for science. (she crushes the flower)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold the dawn of a new age. From a canisters labeled PROJECT GILGAMESH, Ivy removes a savage, other-worldly plant with HISSING fangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have created a race of plants with the strength of the deadliest animals.  Once you have frozen mankind, my mutants will overrun the globe.  The Earth will become a brave new world of only plants. And we shall rule them.  For we will be the only two people left in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Evil. Freeze lifts the Gotham bauble, holds it on his palm, his gauntlet glowing blue, tiny Gotham freezing.  He CRUSHES city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will distract the bat and bird while I prepare to freeze Gotham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just ice them along with the rest of the citizenry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is far too merciful.  Batman will watch his beloved Gotham perish, then I will kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a team, the duncely duo protect each other.  But the Robin is young. Impetuous.  If I could get him alone-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One kiss and you could lift the mask from his lifeless face.  Their secret identities would be revealed.  But how best to bait a brid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way to a boy's heart is through his ego.  What strapping young hero could resist his very own...signal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspired, Ms. Ivy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.  I think I'll have poultry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara and Dick stand talking to a DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Stage One of McGregor's Syndrome. I'm sorry.  All we can do is make him comfortable. PUSH IN through a partially open door in the b.g...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred lays on his bed.  Bruce in black tie, kneels besid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spent my whole life trying to beat back death.  What good are all my heroics now if I can't save you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone dies, Master Bruce.  There's no defeat in that.  Victory comes in fighting for what we know is right while we still live. 394A        Bruce looks past Alfred.  There in the adjace young Alfred finishes reading to a  young Bruce.  Shuts o the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember this.  And remember it always.  I'm proud of you.  And I love you too, son. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OVER) the doorbell is RINGING.  Dick follows Bruce downstairs, the billionaire donning his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McGregor's Syndrome.  That's what Freeze's wife had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  But Alfred's condition is less severe.  Freeze's research says he cured a case like Alfred's.  It just doesn't say how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked the medical database.  No one else is even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late for the dedication.  Then I go after Freeze and Ivy.  Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick, don't push me right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what?  No one can capture Ivy but the big bad Bat.  Crap!  You just want her for yourself.  Don't you?  Answer me, damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  Yes, I want her so badly I can taste it.  That's the whole point. Look at us.  Orphans.  Isolated. Obsessed to the exclusion of life, love, family.  We're perfect targets. She's done something to us, got us fighting over her somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail the all-knowing Bruce Wayne. Here's what I know, she loves me, Not you and it's driving you crazy. It's why you stopped us from kissing. Because if you can't have her, nobody can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's clouded your mind.  You're not thinking straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh but I am.  For the first time in a long time.  I'm through living in your shadow.  All that ends right now. 395A        Dick walks away.  Bruce stares after him. (OV RINGS again.  The front door swings open, Julie ENTERS. limo sits out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been ringing forever.  Where's Alfred? But Bruce doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara stands over the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I was too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late for what, dear child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to give you your freedom, a chance to live the life you choose. The same gift you gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been part of the greatest adventure ever know.  I have found purpose here, and the family I could never have. Alfred smiles, is hit by a sudden wave of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must do something for me. Alfred takes her hand, puts an envelope in her grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find my brother Wilfred.  Give him This.  I have duties he must fulfill in my stead.  Only family can be trusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the hearts of two good men whom I have had the honor of calling son.  Take it, child.  But I implore you, never open it. (he touches her cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so like your mother. And with that his eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black tie gala celebrating the telescope unveiling. PAMELA ISLEY stands in the center of the room.  Alone. Her drab outfit and demeanor make her anything but a  conversation magnet. Bruce and Julie ENTER, smiling through the storm of FLASHBULBS, and the crowd of PRESS, being greeting guests.  Commissioner Gordon steps away, reaches for champagne off a try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wondered, where does that big old bat light come from? Pamela stands before Gordon.  She flips open a compact, blows a pile of love dust, the tiny swirl catching the co in the face, a bit more hitting Bruce who stands behind the Commissioner. GORDON - CLOSE.  Stunned.  And suddenly in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on top of police headquarters. Pam takes Gordon's arm, leads him like a puppy into an al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just love to see it.  But you probably don't have access.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, I'm Commissioner of Police. (patting his pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the keys right here. 401        BRUCE, still standing with Julie, amidst the P WELL-WISHERS, seems suddenly distracted, begins looking around the room. As if summoned by an inaudible call, Bruce peels away fro a perplexed Julie, begins searching the crowd.  A man on quest. PAM has Gordon against the alcove wall.  Her fingers slip into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On second thought, you're way too old for me. She pushes a stunned Gordon away, spins, heads towards th door, tossing something in her hand.  Gordon's keys. 402        A HAND grabs her.  Pam spins to face Bruce Way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Isley.  it was like I could feel you in the room.  You're...enchanting. Gorgeous.  The most beautiful woman I've ever seen.  If you're..um... free...this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arriving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce?  What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's asking me on a date, in an awkward, stammering sort of way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of commitment anxiety, but this is insane.  You're not really propositioning another woman right in front of me. Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, define 'propositioning'. The PRESS has noticed the conflict, now surround Bruce, Julie and Pam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a choice, Bruce.  Her or me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...um...her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crestfallen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right.  I get it.  You're not the marrying kind.  You've made your point.  Goodbye Bruce Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physical perfection, charm and wealth tossed over for a dowdy spinster. How do you explain your behavior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.  But perhaps tonight, over dinner...I've just had an opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe your witless playboy persona works on every bimbo du jour but I am not the least bit titillated by your attentions.  So back off or I'll have you in court quicker than you can spell sexual harassment.  Got me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks are staring.  MURMUR to each other.  Bruce is chagrined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean dinner's a no? Pam has already pushed past him, out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just I sort of...kind of ...love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze stands, putting on his suit. He SNAPS his fingers.  A legion of Icemen step out of the swirling mists.  Freeze lifts his freezing engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bundle up boys.  There's a storm coming. Freeze and his battalion head into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant door swings open.  Bane and Ivy emerge onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let there be light. Bane walks to he dormant Batsignal, TEARS it from its shackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara ENTERS, lost in grief.  She sits, turns Alfred's envelope over in her hand.  A long beat.  She withdraws a single, silver CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only family can be trusted? Barbara slides the disk into her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access denied.  Protected files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you didnâ€™t give me your genes.  But you gave me your heart. Barbara begins hacking the disk, trying to break the code

dialogues.speaker: 406A INT.-WAYNE MANOR-HALLWAY-NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bruce, still in his tux, ENTERS, sits at the main batcomp console, distraught, starting in to the darkness of the c 407A        A YOUNGER ALFRED stands with an ADOLESCENT BR together over the original Batsuit prototype. 407B        BRUCE - CLOSE.  As the images dissipate to me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred, old friend, I could use your help right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here, sir. 408        Bruce spins, stunned.  A monitor flickers into The words COMPUTER SIMULATION flash under an image of Alfred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I anticipated a moment might arrive where I became...incapacitated.  As such, I programmed my brain algorithms into the batcomputer and created a virtual simulation. Bruce stares a beat.  Then he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What seems to be the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, sir, does not compute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Ivy had an intoxicating effect on both Dick and me.  Tonight my feelings spread to someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specify, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela Isley.  I was so attracted to her I couldn't reason clearly.  I still can't.  She used to work for Wayne Enterprises.  Find a file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming on line now, sir. A spinning Isley appears on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was her area of research? Study and report titles scroll up the side of the image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advanced botany.  DNA splicing. Recombinant animal plant patterns. Pheromone extractions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pheromones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glandular secretions from animals. Scents that create powerful emotions.  Fear.  Rage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passion.  Of course.  Find the photo of Ivy after the flower ball. A spinning Ivy appears beside the spinning Isley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deconstruct and resolve. Schematics of various features, finger and retina prints, height, weight, are highlighted and compared.  All match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing what a good wig and contact lenses can do.  And I thought Clark Kent got away with murder just wearing those glasses. Suddenly ALERT panels start flashing.  ALARMS SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears, sir, that someone has stolen the batsignal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara is still hacking away at the disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access code accepted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be one hell of a secret. She hits a key. a Pictures begin to reflect in the dark o her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze's trucks SCREECH to a stop, Freeze and Bane at the helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what they tell you, it's the size of your gun that counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant TELESCOPE of the Gotham Observatory aims into the night. 411        CAMERA CONTINUES UP to the heavens as the BATS appears in the sky.  Then something amazing happens.  The familiar beacon turns blood red, the shape within changin from a bat to bird.  THE ROBIN SINGAL shines over Gotham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ROBIN SIGNAL glows on the central monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce stands in civvies talking to Dick who is suiting up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no batlight, it's a birdcall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name is Pamela Isley.  I saw her talking to Gordon.  She must have stolen his keys, altered the signal-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she did it all for me.  For love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's infected us with some kind of pheromone extract-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it, Bruce?  I'm under some magic spell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd say anything to keep me away from her.  To keep her for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You once said to me that being part of a team means trusting your partner.  That sometimes counting on someone else is the only way to win.  DO you remember? Dick doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't just talking about being partners.  You were talking about being a family.  Well, part of our family is dying.  I'm not going to lose everyone I've ever loved.  So I'm asking you now, friend, partner, brother - will you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scientist and his Associate stand amidst the debris from the party, testing the telescope.  (OVER) A TREMENDO SMASHING. ON THE FLOOR BELOW Freeze and Bane Enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Sorry about the door.  Is the party over? BANE begins pulling charges from his satchel and setting them around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is this nutball? 417        Freeze points up, FIRES a cryonic BLAST at him him to ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mr. Nutball to you.  Half a set of bookends. (to the Associate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  Go like this. Freeze pantomimes the Scientist's frozen expression of terror for the Associate.  The Associate, terrified, imitates Freeze's move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  move your hands up.  Higher. Now a hint more fear.  Excellent. 418        Freeze fires another BLAST, freezing the Assoc the same position as the Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A matched pair.  Sometimes I exceed even my wildest expectations. Freeze smiles at the mighty telescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If revenge is a dish best served cold, then put on your Sunday finest.  It's time to feast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Dormant.  The automatic activation sequence engage Ambient lights come on.  Computers flicker into life. The giant Batmobile pedestal begins to rise.  On it, no car but a single figure standing now in the center of the cave.  Barbara. 419A        BARBARA - CLOSE.        Eyes wide with awe. Barbara walks to the main terminal of the Batcomputer. Touches the console.  The Alfred simulation appears on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Alfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In spirit only, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys need help. 420        The image of Alfred stares at her a beat.  The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother would be proud. 421        MAIN SCREEN - CLOSE.  Flickers into life.  Cos schematics turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive my being personal, dear girl, but I must know your size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin arrives the entrance to the dark baths, lush, inviting, mysterious.  He passes the giant bird signal chained to the door, the spotlight shutting out as he disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giant floral fans spin.  Leaf curtains undulate.  Fruits burst with color.  In the center of the cave, a giant bed of buds.  Ivy touches the buds.  All instantly blossom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your thumb the only part of you that's green? Ivy looks up.  A figure stands in the darkness.  She smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll just have to find out. Ivy extends her hand.  Robin steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze attaches the icing engine to the telescope.  Bane finishes laying his explosive charges, joins Freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big family?  Like pets?  Don't talk much, do you? 424        Freeze engages the engine.  Suddenly the entir is washed in a blue wave of freezing cryonic energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambient ice wave spreads down, encasing the old structure.  The nearby banks whiten, turning into snow cliffs, the river freezing into an icy channel.  The Observatory has transformed into a fortress of ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS.  Boots are pulled on.  A slim utility belt LOCKS.  A cape WHIPS over a lithe female back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivy sits on the bed, draws Robin down beside her, faces close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you came.  I can't breathe without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want us to be together.  But I need to know you're serious about turning over a new leaf.  I need a sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about dangerous curves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of trust. Tell me your plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me and I'll tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me and I'll kiss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze has turned the new telescope into a freezing gun.  He's about to turn Gotham into an ice cube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recoiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling him back in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One kiss, my love.  For luck. Robin can't resist.  They kiss.  Ivy pulls back, holds hi gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad luck, I'm afraid.  It's time to die, little bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have heeded your pointy- eared pal.  These lips can be murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you never loved me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you?  I loathe your bipedal arrogance, your animal superiority. My only joy is knowing that even now my poison kiss is sucking the life from your ape-like face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying I told you so. 428        Ivy spins.  From the shadows, a figure emerges

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too late.  Say bye-bye birdie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you.  But rubber lips are immune to your charms. Robin peels a rubber coating from his mouth.  Ivy stares in dismay.

dialogues.speaker: 428A BATMAN
dialogues.text: Robin and I found the cure to your evil spell.  And that's teamwork. 428B        Then she SCREAMS her rage. She shoves Robin i lily pool, the Boy Wonder immediately tangled into predat vines. 428C        MORE VINES wrench Batman hanging upside down ceiling, the stalks squeezing our heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, boys, my vines have a little crush on you. Ivy begins leaping across lily pads towards the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta run.  So many people to kill. So little time. 431        THE SKYLIGHT - EXPLODES.  The room fills with 432        A figure comes flipping down from above.  Long ears.  Black leather. BATGIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about to become compost. 433        Ivy and Batgirl begin a furious martial arts b (CHOREOGRAPHY TO COME). BATMAN pulls a bat-knife, begins cutting himself free. ROBIN struggles to untangle himself from the aquatic vine BATGIRL is fighting Ivy, feet flying, hands moving like lighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using feminine wiles to get what you want.  Trading on your looks. Exploiting men's weakness for sex. Read a book, sister.  That passive- aggressive crap went out in the seventies.  Chicks like you give women a bad name. BATMAN deftly slashes through his captor vines. ROBIN struggles, trying to free himself IVY gets the upper hand, backs Batgirl against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I told Lady Freeze when I pulled her plug, this is a one woman show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. 438        Batgirl grabs Ivy's hair, knocking her out wit to the forehead, then batcuffs her. BATMAN cuts himself freed, drops to the floor to face Bat ROBIN pulls himself, dripping, from the pool.

dialogues.speaker: 438A BATMAN
dialogues.text: And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batgirl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not awfully PC.  How about Batwoman?  Batperson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.  Barbara.  I found the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get those locks changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows who we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we'll just have to kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill her later.  We've got work to do. 439        The three heroes race into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze stands on the platform, giant telescope in his hands.  (OVER) approaching SIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1-Adam 12, 1-Adam-12, see the mad scientist with the freezing ray. 441        A SQUAD OF CRUISERS SCREAM up the avenue towar observatory, their bubble lights flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops on the rocks, anyone? 444        He FIRES a giant blue beam of cryonic energy a street below. 445        THE COP CARS become skidding, SCREECHING cubes They SHASH into each other, EXPLODE into a pyre of raging flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police are so hot tempered these days.  Don't you agree, Mr. Bane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek one man ice sail (THE BATSLED) blows out onto the frozen water.  Robin is at the helm. 450        A modified white Batmobile on rocket skis (THE BATHAMMER), BLASTS onto the ice, falling in alongside the Batsled.  Batman drives. A single-bladed, rocket snowcylce (THE BATBLADE), whips onto the ice, falling into the attack line.  Batgirl helm the craft. The bat-force BLASTS upriver towards the icy Observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TELESCOPE VIEWFINDER - CLOSE.  The Batvehicles are visibl through the lens.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE
dialogues.text: Ivy failed to unmask the Dynamic Duo.  No matter, the Bat and Bird are mine at last.  Watch, Batman, as your beloved Gotham freezes.  And prepare to die.  Because you're next. Freeze points the telescope downtown.  He FIRES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks walking their dogs, drinking on stoops, kissing against alley walls, mailboxes, lampposts, the pavement itself, are all suddenly encased in glistening ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bat-allion approaches.  Icemen. Attack. FREEZE'S TRUCK bursts through the mists, BLASTING down th frozen river on blades, two pairs of icemen hanging from tail lines on skis, machine guns BLAZING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack plan alpha. Batman peels left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha.  Roger. Robin peels right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha.  Got it. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is attack plan Alpha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divide and conquer. Robin is flying downriver.  One pair of icemen sweep out alongside the truck, heading towards Robin's billowing craft, guns FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second pair of skiing icemen whip towards Batgirl, thei guns SPITTING rounds of shells into the ice around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side mounted rocket launchers FIRE towards the Bathammer, BLOWING holes in the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman maneuvers, managing to swerve around the sudden, steaming pools.  He GUNS the TURBOS, heading straight for the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two icemen bearing down on Robin release their tethers, converging on the Batsled, guns FIRING madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tack. Robin pulls the boom and the sail LUFFS.  His boat sudden changes course and the two skiers COLLIDE, flying onto th ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I hope Freeze hires these guys by the dozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skiers are closing fast.  Batgirl hits a key and a  status panel displays a menu of the Batblade's special modifications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice extras package. 472        PANEL - CLOSE.  Barbara selects a setting call Cutter. 473        THE BATBLADE scythe peels back, revealing a sh 474        BATGIRL uses her deft driving skills to spin a skid, her blade sending a wave of frozen ice into the faces of the icemen, the villains tumbling in backwards somersaults across the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I call a close shave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman is shooting the center of the frozen river, headin straight for the ice truck, its side guns BLAZING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman hits a control stud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two torpedoes shoot out of the Bathammer chassis, hitting the frozen river directly in front of Freeze's truck, ice flying skyward in a tremendous EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver can't swerve in time, the hole in the ice dead ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck hits the steaming pool, flipping up, nose first, and begins to sink into the icy waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman races past the sinking truck, Icemen crawling to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sink and drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the pulse of Freeze's BEAMS hitting the city, the Batvehciles fire TURBOS, closing in on the Observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze tilts his gun down towards the frozen river below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast.  Time you cooled your heals. Freeze FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frozen channel ahead of the bat-force is hit by the FREEZING RAY.  A giant wall of rock-hard ice forms, block ing the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batman hits a console stud marked:        EMERGENCY BURN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bathammer engines ROAR, the Bathammer BLOWING straigh through the frozen wall in an EXPLOSION of ice. 488B        THE BADTBLADE and the BATSLED shoots up the f wall on either side of the Bathammer, soaring over the top of the mountain of snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: As I told Lady Freeze when I pulled her plug, this is a one woman show. FREEZE SCREAMS his rage.  His face streams with frozen tears, like tiny diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's not dead, Victor.  We found her, restored her icy slumber. 593        BATMAN'S GAUNTLET MONITOR shows Mrs. Fries res cryogenic slumber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still frozen, Victor, alive, waiting for you to find a cure.  I know what it's like to lose everything you've ever loved.  But vengeance isn't power.  Any two-bit thug with a gun can take a life.  To give life, that's true power, a power you once had.  I don't know if you'll ever find a cure for your wife.   But I'm asking you now, Doctor Victor Fries, to save another life. Show me how to cure McGregor's Syndrome Stage One.  And maybe you can also save the man your wife once  loved.  He's still inside you, buried  somewhere deep beneath the snow.   Will you help me?  Doctor? Freeze stares at Batman.  Finally he unseals his chestplate, removes two glowing power orbs, holds them out, his smile, bittersweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take two of these and call me in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: The prison is secure once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves me.  He loves me not. He loves me.  he loves me...

dialogues.text: Not. A figure stands cloaked in shadows.  He steps forward. Mr. Freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off his suit)

dialogues.text: Prepare for a bitter harvest. Winter has come at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good.

dialogues.text: Morning breaks on the great old building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: World War III was lost in this room.  Strewn clothes. Barbara dozes on the couch.  Dick paces.  Bruce stands, staring out the window, afraid he has lost Alfred forever (OVER) a THROAT CLEARS.  LOUDER. All look up.  Alfred is descending the stairs.  Scowling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred, are you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather disappointed at how poorly I taught you proper housekeeping. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And quite well, it seems.  Thanks to you, son.  Thanks to you all. The three move to him.  A family reunion.  Dick turns to Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One question.  When Batgirl and I rolled off the telescope, how come you didn't try and save us? It was the first time I fell and you weren't there to catch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you could handle it. Barbara CLEARS her throat.  Dick shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes counting on someone else is the only way to win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm the one who kicked Ivy's botanical butt.  Personally.  Me.  I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are going back to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never going to win this argument, Bruce. Barbara extends her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partners? A beat.  The other heroes follow suit.  A team is born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to need a bigger cave.
